segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s making me really anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see the water pouring onto the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get into trouble if they step in that puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is already on a shaky stool, and now he might slip too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at her to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she’s so calm, like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s even aware of the kids behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me really uncomfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to walk over and fix everything myself.
segments.speaker: PAR
